;;;[03] Accept pigs Primates with kidney transplants can survive;;2;;years;;

;

;October 11, "Nature" ) published online the collaborative research paper Design and testing of a humanized porcine donor for xenotransplantation, an American biotechnology company eGenesis and Harvard Medical School. The research team designed a genetically modified pig kidney donor that can be used clinically. and successfully achieved xenotransplantation and long-term survival in non-human primates.

;

;To overcome the obstacle of immune rejection of xenogeneic organs and improve the safety of transplantation, researchers performed 69 genome edits on Yucatan mini pig donors, including knocking out genes thought to cause immune rejection Three glycan antigens (3KO), overexpressing 7 human transgenes (7TG) to reduce rejection by the primate immune system while simultaneously inactivating all copies of porcine retroviral genes (RI). Experimental results found that transplantation of donor kidneys carrying human transgenes into cynomolgus monkeys can significantly extend survival time. A cynomolgus monkey that received a transplant of a pig kidney containing knockout and human transgenes simultaneously received a clinically relevant immune transplantation protocol. Survival time exceeds 2 years (758 days). The experiment is still ongoing.

;

;;• ;;Comments : The above research results prove that genetically modified pig kidneys can survive for a long time after xenotransplantation, showing the prospects of transplanting pig organs into humans. In January 2022 and September 2023, based on the U.S. FDA’s “Compassionate Use” program, the University of Maryland School of Medicine completed two cases of living human transplants of pig hearts. Although large-scale clinical application of xenotransplantation is still far away, scientific exploration continues. (Luo Xianxian);

;

;;;【04】 A new mechanism for plants to achieve distant hybridization through sexual reproduction;;

;

;On October 7, Peking University School of Life Sciences, Peking University-Tsinghua Joint Center for Life Sciences, New Cornerstone Scientific Experiment The Murogo Reika/Zhong Sheng team published a paper on Antagonistic RALF peptides control an intergeneric hybridization barrier on Brassicaceae stigmas at the molecular level, analyzing the Arabidopsis stigma recognition and acceptance of its own pollen and recent The mechanism of receiving pollen from distant relatives but not pollen from distant relatives clarifies the mechanism of interspecific/intergeneric reproductive barriers. Using this result, they successfully achieved distant hybridization between two plant species that began to diverge 27 million years ago and now belong to two different genera and obtained hybrid embryos.

;

;;• ;;Comments : New species are important for maintaining biodiversity on Earth. Hybridization between different species is an important mechanism for the formation of new species. Many important economic crops such as wheat, cotton, and rapeseed are all derived from hybridization between plants in nature. This discovery explains the mechanism of reproductive barriers in hybridization between different species of plants, reveals the molecular basis of key reproductive hybridization barriers at plant stigmas, and thus finds a simple and effective way to break key reproductive barriers. This has important theoretical significance and broad application prospects for realizing distant hybridization of plants and creating new germplasm resources for agriculture, horticulture and other fields. (Luo Xianxian);

;

;;;[05] A method that can promote wound healing Nanofiber hydrogel;;

;

;On October 6, the team of Professor Wang Xiaoying of South China University of Technology, the team of Associate Professor Zhang Huantian and Professor Zha Zhengang of the First Affiliated Hospital of Jinan University, Published a paper Collagen fibril-like injectable hydrogels from self-assembled nanoparticles for promoting wound healing  strategy to develop a collagen fibrillar injectable hydrogel with low hardness, high compressive strength, anti-swelling, drug loading and biodegradability.

;

;This study used the self-assembly between methacrylated hydroxypropyl chitosan (HM) and hectorite (LAP) to form nanoparticles, and then prepared a kind of nanoparticles through inter-particle photo-cross-linking. Injectable, soft yet tough and anti-swelling nanofiber hydrogels are used to promote wound healing. The hydrogel has good biocompatibility and biodegradability, and accelerates wound healing by accelerating cell migration and promoting the formation and maturation of new blood vessels. ;;;;;;

;

;< span style="color: #ba1010;">;• ;;Comments: This new biomimetic hydrogel It has great potential in various soft tissue engineering applications such as wound dressings, and provides a general strategy for the development of bionic nanofiber soft hydrogels and rapid healing of perioperative incisions and wounds, which has clinical translation value. (Li Yiyi);

;

;;;【06】Discovering the Ocean Key pigment synthase for photosynthesis;;

;

;On October 6, Li Xiaobo’s team from the School of Life Sciences of West Lake University published a paper A chlorophyll c synthase  in Science widely co-opted by phytoplankton, the gene encoding chlorophyll c synthase and the mechanism of action of the enzyme were revealed for the first time. The research team selected dozens of candidate genes from the Phaeodactylum tricornutum genome based on the expression levels of each gene under different growth conditions, and sequentially carried out knockout and phenotypic testing, and discovered chlorophyll c synthase (Chl c synthase, (referred to as CHLC); combined with Tara Oceans global marine biological survey data, the research team found that CHLC homologous genes are widely distributed in the global ocean; phylogenetic analysis results show that brown algae may use unknown, independently evolved enzymes to synthesize chlorophyll c. This result also shows that the current evolutionary theory of photosynthesis mechanism still needs to be revised.

;

;;• ;;Comments : Photosynthesis is the basis of all life on earth. It is a complex process that humans cannot yet fully decipher. The above research solves a problem that has long plagued the field of marine photosynthesis and opens the door to the synthetic biology application of the light-harvesting mechanism of marine algae. (Luo Xianxian);

;;;[07] Toyota Motor and Idemitsu Kosan cooperate on all-solid-state batteries;;

;

;On October 12, Toyota Motor and Idemitsu Kosan ) announced that the two parties will cooperate to develop large-scale production technology for solid electrolytes, improve productivity, and build a supply chain, with the goal of commercialization in 2027-2028, followed by mass production. Idemitsu Kosan has invested in basic technology research and development of all-solid-state batteries since 2001, while Toyota started in 2006. The focus of this cooperation between the two parties is sulfide solid electrolytes, which are considered to be ideal materials for power batteries that achieve high capacity and high output.

;

;;• ;;Comments : All-solid-state batteries are seen as the next generation of batteries, with higher energy density and faster charging. In recent years, Toyota has been criticized by the outside world for not being active enough in the field of vehicle electrification. It turns out that it is already laying out next-generation technologies. (Li Yiju);

;

;;;[08] Maersk will add Starlink to container ships;;;;

;

;October 12 On September 1, Danish logistics giant Maersk announced that it would add SpaceX’s Starlink satellite network to more than 330 of its own container ships, providing high-speed Internet services exceeding 200 megabits per second. The installation is expected to be in 2024. Completed in the first quarter of the year. Starlink is a global communications network that Elon Musk's SpaceX has been building and has launched more than 5,000 satellites.

;

;High-speed internet will enable seamless streaming and high-definition video calling for crews and will also facilitate cost-saving measures by migrating business-critical applications to the cloud and enhancing remote support and inspections of ships.

;

;;• ;;Comments : Satellite networks are breaking the limitations of ground base stations and helping people better access high-speed Internet. This cooperation with Maersk is a breakthrough in the ocean, especially in the high seas, from ocean to high altitude, from special equipment to portable Smartphones, the commercial value and application scenarios of satellite networks are continuing to expand. (Li Yiyi);

;

;On October 10, AMD announced the acquisition of AI software startup Nod.ai to expand its open source artificial intelligence software capabilities, but The purchase price was not disclosed.

;

;Nod.ai, founded in 2013, is an artificial intelligence and machine learning systems company that provides key open source technologies for artificial intelligence systems. Nod.ai has developed code generation technologies such as SHARK;, ;Torch-MLIR and OpenXLA/IREE, which have been widely deployed in the cloud, edge and endpoint devices, and can help enterprises quickly deploy optimization for AMD chips artificial intelligence model.

;;;【10 ] Schaeffler acquires Vitesco Technology;;

;

;On October 9, Schaeffler Group announced the acquisition of Vitesco Technology with a cash offer of 3.64 billion euros (91 euros per share) (Vitesco) to strengthen the Schaeffler Group's competitive position in the electric mobility industry. Vitesco Technology has core components and advanced system solutions for electric vehicles, and both parties have a highly complementary technology portfolio.

;

;Vitesco Technology was spun off from Continental’s powertrain division in 2018 and will be listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange in 2021. The Schaeffler family is its largest single shareholder. The family also holds controlling stakes in Schaeffler Group and Continental AG.

;

;The transaction has been submitted to the German Federal Financial Supervisory Authority for approval and is expected to be completed in the fourth quarter of 2024. By then, the new Schaeffler Group will become a parts giant with more than 120,000 employees, 44 R&D centers and more than 100 production bases around the world, with revenue of approximately 25 billion euros. ;;;;;< /span>;

;

;;• ;;Comment: The automobile industry is about to give birth to a new auto parts giant. The electrification transformation of the automobile industry has also made the mergers and acquisitions and reorganization of the auto parts industry chain exciting. (Li Yiyi);

;; ;[11] Amazon launches the first two space Internet test satellites;;

;

;On October 6, two prototype satellites of the Amazon Space Internet Kuiper Project (Kuiper Project) KuiperSat-1 and KuiperSat-2 were launched from Cape Canaveral Space Station in Florida on United Launch Alliance (ULA) Atlas V rockets and deployed at an altitude of 311 miles (approximately 500 kilometers) above the Earth.

;

;This is the first satellite launched by the Kuiper project. Amazon launched Project Kuiper in 2018 and received a license from the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to deploy and operate satellites in July 2020. ;;;;;;;;;;

;

;;• ;;Comment: In April 2022, Amazon announced that it had signed a space agreement with Arianespace, Blue Origin and United Launch Alliance (ULA). This launch officially opened Amazon’s space communication infrastructure, and satellite communications will also launch a new round of competition. (Tang Jiale);

;;;[12] New treatment for common cancers in infants and young children obtained< /strong>;;FDA;;Expert Committee Support;;

;

;On October 4, the US FDA Oncology Drugs Advisory Committee voted 14:6 The results support the efficacy of eflornithine (DFMO), an investigational therapy from US pharmaceutical company US World Meds, in reducing the risk of recurrence in pediatric patients with high-risk neuroblastoma. US WorldMeds did not use randomized clinical trials (RCT) when developing eflornithine, which is expected to create a precedent that does not rely on RCT to support the approval of new drugs.

;

;Neuroblastoma is one of the most common cancers in infants and young children. It is an extremely aggressive tumor. The 5-year survival rate of conventional treatments is only 10;%;—20%. eflornithine is an oral, irreversible inhibitor of ornithine decarboxylase (ODC). In a Phase 2 clinical trial, patients treated with eflornithine showed no significant improvement compared with an external control group selected based on historical data. Both event survival and overall survival were significantly improved.

;

;;• ;;Comments : RCT is a common choice for the clinical development of new drugs, but in patients with rare diseases or serious, fatal diseases, randomized controlled clinical trials may face challenges and ethical issues. The support of the U.S. FDA Oncology Drugs Advisory Committee recognizes the effectiveness and safety of eflornithine in the treatment of neuroblastoma. It also provides more support for the clinical application of this drug, so that patients can have more treatment options and hope for survival. . (Luo Xianxian);
